isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION, TANDEM DRIVE AXLES: EATON - LUBRICATION - CHANGING LUBE

svcsubproc.title: Draining
svcsubproc.para: Drain when the lube is at normal operating temperature. It will run freely and minimize the time necessary to fully drain the axle.
Unscrew the magnetic drain plug on the underside of the axle housing and allow the lube to drain into a suitable container.

note.para: Dispose of all used lubricants properly by following disposal methods approved for petroleum or synthetic- based oils.

svcsubproc.para: Inspect drain plug for large quantities of metal particles. After initial oil change, these are signs of damage or extreme wear in the axle. Inspection of the entire unit may be warranted. Clean the drain plug and replace it after the lube has drained completely. Inspect breather for clogging or corrosion. Clean or replace as necessary.

svcsubproc.title: Filling
svcsubproc.para: Remove the filler hole plug from the center of the axle housing cover and fill the axle with approved lubricant until level with the bottom of the hole.

note.para: The axle can be filled through the breather hole. Fill to bottom of filler hole in cover.

svcsubproc.title: Standpipes
svcsubproc.para: Axles installed at angles exceeding 10 degrees and operated regularly in areas of continuous grades may require standpipes to allow proper fill levels.

svcsubproc.title: Final Check
svcsubproc.para: Prior to putting vehicle back into service, run the vehicle to bring axle lube up to temperature.
Check filler and drain plugs and axle joints for leakage. Re-tighten to specifications as necessary.
